title: COPIC Official Website - Copic is a brand of professional quality markers founded in 1987 by the Too Group in Tokyo, Japan. Our durable graphic markers are alcohol-based, refillable and available in various designs and 358 colors to suit individual needs.
meta_description: Copic is a brand of professional quality markers founded in 1987 by the Too Group in Tokyo, Japan. Our durable graphic markers are alcohol-based, refillable and available in various designs and 358 colors to suit individual needs.

internal_pages.title: What is Copic? Find out more about Copic - COPIC Official Website
internal_pages.meta_description: What’s Copic? Copic’s iconic graphic markers are loved by creative professionals, artists and hobbyists alike, from beginner to professional.

Copic Collection
What is Copic?
Meeting every creative need.

Copic was developed and launched in 1987 to meet the needs of the times -
a graphic marker that could be applied overprinting ink.

As each new product is released,
the astounding spectrum of colors grows.

There's a myriad of ways you can use Copic:

rough sketches for architecture,
fashion,
automotive design
landscapes
portraits
manga and illustrations
coloring costumes
And even coloring fishing lures

The more diverse the use,
the wider the world of expression becomes.

The potential contained in just one marker equals the number of people who use it.
The imagination of each individual becomes the driving force in producing our markers.


We cannot hide our excitement when we think of the endless possibilities for those who use Copic.

We hope that everyone - both adults and children alike -
can express themselves in their own unique way.

We aim to offer more freedom in how and where you create,
augmenting the scope of possibility for all creators.

Versatility

Initially developed as a rendering tool for professional designers, Copic is now used in many other fields such as illustration, fine art, architecture, manga and crafts.

See the collaborations page

More than 30 years of history

Copic was developed and launched in 1987 as the next generation graphic marker to meet the needs of professional designers.
With the extension of Copic Sketch in the nineties, both featuring the Super Brush nib, Copic became a treasured tool worldwide in many creative fields beyond design.

See the history page

A complete line-up

With a history of over 35 years, Copic alcohol markers offer a

Copic Collection
COPIC HISTORY

Created as first markers which do not dissolve copy machines' toners.
Over the years we managed to increase the number of colors to meet the needs of various markets.

1919
Foundation of Izumiya

Ms. Ishii Soyo opens Izumiya, an art supply store in Tokyo's Shibuya Ward, and begins her career in importing art supplies.

Markers become popular tools among designers and to meet this demand, Izumiya starts importing and selling Speedry Markers, an American brand developed exclusively for this audience.

1963
Import of Speedry Markers begins
1968
Production of Speedry Markers in Japan begins

American Magic marker and Izumiya form a joint venture called 'Magic Marker Corporation Japan' and start domestic production of Speedry Markers.

To work efficiently design professionals relied on copy machines, however the coloring tools available did not perform well combined with photocopies as these dissolved the ink of the printed lines and created smears on the paper.
Izumiya set out to solve this problem and develop the next generation graphic marker that would enable designers to work with freshly printed photocopies without issues. Each component was carefully engineered and manufactured in Japan against highest quality standards, a key criterion for the prototype was also to make it refillable to last longer and reduce waste.
The new marker was aptly named Copic, deriving from the word “copies” and the pale gray chosen was similar to the color of copy machines at the time to create a close link to the origin. With an ergonomic square design and dual nibs, it was launched in 71 colors with matching refills called Variou

Copic Collection
COPIC COLOR SYSTEM

Our iconic Copic Color System is a systematized chart representing color spectrum of all 358 alcohol markers and their characteristics.
Based on the color wheel concept, this tool allows you to intuitively choose the colors you want.

Each of 358 Copic alcohol markers (Copic classic, Sketch and Ciao) colors has its own specific number, and there is a meaning behind each letter and digit in it. Knowing this makes the process of choosing colors quick, easy and more enjoyable.

＊Our Copic Color Wheel has recently been renewed (update: 2021/5/10).

Picture of the color wheel

Copic color numbers consist of 3 elements - letters representing the hue (dominant color family) and a set of digits, the first one indicating color saturation and the rest representing the brightness of the color.

Hue (Dominant Color Family)

Letters represent a rough hue (dominant color family).
Each letter is an acronym indicating a color family - R stands for 'red', B for 'blue', and BV for 'blue violet'.

* Regarding the E series - this series consists of muddy tones from R ('red') and YR ('yellow red') series. We named this series 'earth colors' so that it would be easier to select the brown tones.
* Regarding the achromatic gray colors - we considered each tone of gray as a part of a hue, and divided them into 4 groups according to their characteristics.
* Fluorescent colors have a letter F (acronym for 'flourescent') in their color number.
* Colorless 0 and black (1) are exceptions.

Saturation

Next to the letters we have a digit representing color saturation. The degree of saturation is divided into 10 groups, starting from 0 an

Tools Shops

Art supply store directly managed by Too Marker Products, the manufacturer of Copic markers.
There are 3 stores in total and all of them are located near train stations. Tools also has an e-commerce website called Tools Web Shop.
Besides that, at Ochanomizu store your can find "Copic Clinic" where we replace nibs and refill markers with ink.

Tools Ochanomizu

2 Chome-1-30 Kanda Surugadai, Chiyoda City, Tokyo 101-0062
TEL: 03-3295-1438 FAX: 03-3295-1440 Opening hours: 9:30~19:00 ※Saturday and Sunday: 10:00~18:30
https://www.tools-shop.jp/shop/ochanomizu/

Yokohama Joinus

Joinus, 1 Chome-5-1 Minamisaiwai, Nishi Ward, Yokohama, Kanagawa 220-0005
TEL: 045-321-6728 FAX: 045-321-6739 Opening hours: 10:00~21:00
https://www.tools-shop.jp/shop/yokohama/

Tools Osaka Umeda

Whity Umeda, Petite Champs Area, 1-4, Chayamachi, Kita-ku, Osaka City, 530-0013
TEL: 06-6372-9272 FAX: 06-6372-1048 Opening hours: 10:00~21:00
https://www.tools-shop.jp/shop/osaka/
